General

Certain management functions with respect to the Portfolio (including, without limitation, the acquisition, management and disposal of the Collateral) will be performed by Tikehau Capital Europe Limited as the Collateral Manager under the Collateral Management Agreement to be entered into on or about the Issue Date between, inter alios, the Issuer and the Collateral Manager
Tikehau Capital Europe Limited

Tikehau Capital Europe Limited ("TCE") is a limited liability company incorporated in England and Wales on 30 July 2014 with its registered address at 111 Old Broad Street, London EC2N 1AP, United Kingdom and will act as Collateral Manager in accordance with the terms of the Collateral Management Agreement.

TCE was formed primarily to manage a series of structured credit vehicles, primarily investing in senior secured debt. TCE is authorised and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority in the United Kingdom, among other things to provide investment management services.
Overview of Tikehau Capital

TCE is a wholly owned subsidiary of Tikehau Capital, which was founded in 2004 in Paris by Antoine Flamarion and Mathieu Chabran and is a principal investor and alternative asset manager, with a twelve year history and track record.

As at 30th June 2016 Tikehau Capital had approximately € 8.5 billion of committed assets under management across four principal strategies: Principal Investing and Private Equity; Fixed Income, Direct Lending and Leveraged Loans; Public Equities; and Real Estate. Tikehau Capital has over 170 employees and has offices in Paris, London, Brussels, Milan and Singapore. These professionals are active in portfolio management, investment analysis, trading, legal, client service and administration.

Tikehau Investment Management, the existing asset management arm of Tikehau Capital is regulated as a credit investment business by the AMF, the French regulatory body, Autorité des Marches Financiers (AMF) under the AIFMD and UCITS directives.
Management of Collateral Debt Obligations

As the Collateral Manager, TCE will be responsible for selecting, effecting the acquisition of and monitoring the performance of the Collateral Debt Obligations. TCE’s purchase and sale decisions (with certain exceptions) will be reviewed and approved by an investment committee (the "Investment Committee") based upon the recommendation of a credit committee (the "Credit Committee"). Both committees comprise senior members of the Collateral Manager and Tikehau group and have a consensus approach to decision making among the members of the committees.
Management of the Portfolio

New investment opportunities are reviewed by a combination of the Credit Committee and the Investment Committee members and the relevant credit research analyst to assess the general quality of the credit, value, likely liquidity and fit relative to the requirements of the portfolio. If the initial review of the proposed credit is positive, the credit research analyst will prepare a formal credit paper and a recommendation for Credit Committee.

Once a credit is unanimously approved at Credit Committee, which is chaired by the Head of Credit Research, the asset will be recommended to Investment Committee, which comprises Senior Portfolio Managers and the CIO of the Firm, in order to review and assess the suitability of the credit for each Fund and each Fund’s investment appetite, taking into account the criteria, needs and potential impact on the portfolio’s structure on each Fund. The Investment Committee meets as often as necessary to discuss potential new investments and to review existing positions whenever action is required.
Investment Management and Monitoring

Research analysts and portfolio managers are jointly responsible for the investment monitoring process. Each of the research analysts are responsible for monitoring the conditions for several industries and companies within those industries. The credit monitoring process is ongoing and research professionals are responsible for maintaining historic performance information for all credits that are owned as well as comparable issuers and for providing updated analysis and investment recommendations and ratings based on comparative analysis against the original investment thesis based on new financial information, market news, price or other events in order to provide the portfolio manager with a reasoned opinion regarding the future prospects of each company and the industry in which it sits. In doing so the research professionals maintain contact with outside research groups; arranging banks and company management teams, as well as utilizing various software, publications and third party monitoring services.
Transaction Management

Professionals responsible for transaction management will assess an investment’s suitability with respect to the Issuers capital structure and governing agreements. While asset selection is critical, not every asset will fit the Issuer’s requirements at any particular time during the investment period. When TCE considers an investment opportunity, transaction management professionals provide an analysis of that investment’s impact of the Issuer’s portfolio structure. Also these professionals are responsible for accounting and reporting to investors. This function will be maintained by a combination of portfolio administrators, credit and investment committees. Individual loan level data for the assets managed by the Collateral Manager is tracked and maintained on Wall Street Office, which also provide middle office outsourcing services to TCE.

THE RETENTION HOLDER AND RETENTION REQUIREMENTS

The Issuer has accurately reproduced the information contained in the sections entitled "The Retention Holder and Retention Requirements - Description of the Retention Holder" and "The Retention Holder and Retention Requirements – Origination of Collateral Debt Obligations" from information provided to it by the Collateral Manager but it has not independently verified such information. So far as the Issuer is aware and is able to ascertain from information published by the Collateral Manager, no facts have been omitted which would render the reproduced information inaccurate or misleading. The information appearing in this section has been prepared by the Collateral Manager and has not been independently verified by the Issuer, the Arranger, the Placement Agent or any other party and none of such Persons assumes any responsibility for the accuracy, completeness or applicability of such information.
Description of the Retention Holder
Tikehau Capital Europe Limited shall act as Retention Holder for the purposes of the Retention Requirements.
The description and the address of the Retention Holder is set out in the "The Collateral Manager" section of this Prospectus.

As Retention Holder, the Collateral Manager will hold the Retention Notes, as described below, in its capacity as "originator" for the purposes of the Retention Requirements. While, as at the Issue Date, the Retention Holder would be able to satisfy the requirements to qualify as a "sponsor" (as defined in the CRR as of the date hereof) for the purposes of the Retention Requirements (were it not for the exclusion in respect of "an originator institution" in the definition of thereof), it will retain the Retention Notes in its capacity as an eligible "originator" for the purposes of the Retention Requirements pursuant to the Retention Letter.

Prospective investors should consider the discussion in "Risk Factors – Regulatory Initiatives – Regulatory Initiatives – Risk Retention and Due Diligence" and "Risk Factors – Conflicts of Interest – Conflicts of interest Involving or Relating to the Placement and its Affiliates" above.
The Retention

On the Issue Date, the Retention Holder, will execute the Retention Letter addressed to the Issuer, the Trustee (for the benefit of the Noteholders), the Collateral Administrator and Citigroup Global Markets Limited in its capacity as Arranger and Placement Agent.
Under the Retention Letter, the Retention Holder will:

(a) undertake to subscribe for (at the initial issuance and each subsequent date of additional issuance of Notes) and retain, on an ongoing basis and for its own account, in accordance with the Retention Requirements as of the date hereof, a material net economic interest in the first loss tranche of not less than five per cent. of the securitised exposures by subscribing for and holding, on an ongoing basis, and for so long as any Notes are outstanding, Subordinated Notes with a Principal Amount Outstanding equal to not less than five per cent. of (i) on any Business Day prior to the Effective Date, the greater of the Aggregate Collateral Balance and the Maximum Par Amount and (ii) otherwise, the greater of the Maximum Par Amount and the highest Aggregate Collateral Balance recorded from and including the Effective Date to the Maturity Date (the "Retention Notes");

(b) undertake and agree that it and its Affiliates will not sell, hedge or otherwise mitigate its credit risk under or associated with the Retention Notes unless expressly permitted by the Retention Requirements;
(c) agree to confirm its continued compliance with the requirements set out in paragraphs (a) to
(b) above on a monthly basis to the Issuer, the Collateral Manager, the Trustee, the Collateral Administrator and the Arranger (concurrent with the preparation of each Monthly Report);

(d) agree that it will, promptly on becoming aware of the occurrence thereof, provide a written notice to the Issuer, the Trustee, the Collateral Administrator and the Arranger of (i) any failure to hold the Retention Notes in accordance with paragraphs (a) and (b) above or (ii) any representations in the Retention Letter failing to be true on any date;

(e) agree that it will take such further action, provide such information and enter into such other agreements as may reasonably be required to satisfy the Retention Requirements as of (i) the Issue Date and (ii) solely as regards the provision of information in the possession of the Retention Holder and to the extent the same is not subject to a duty of confidentiality, any time prior to the maturity of the Notes at the expense of the entity requesting such additional information;

(f) agree that it will notify the Collateral Administrator, the Issuer and the Arranger in writing of any sale, disposal or acquisition of an interest in the Retention Notes by the Retention Holder promptly following such sale, disposal or acquisition;

(g) represent and warrant that it is and intends, for so long as it is required to retain the Retention Notes, it will retain the Retention Notes in its capacity as an eligible "originator" for the purposes of the Retention Requirements;
(h) represent, warrant, undertake and agree:
(i) that in relation to every Collateral Debt Obligation that it sells or transfers to the Issuer:
(A) it, either itself or through related entities, directly or indirectly, was involved or will be involved in the original agreement which created or will create such obligation; or
(B) it purchased or will purchase such Collateral Debt Obligation for its own account prior to selling such obligation to the Issuer;

(ii) that it has established and is managing the securitisation scheme consisting of the issuance by the Issuer of the Notes described in this Prospectus and appointed the Arranger to provide certain specific services in order to assist with such establishment;
(iii) that it is not an entity that has been established or that operates for the sole purpose of securitising exposures;
(iv) that it has the capacity to meet a payment obligation from resources not related to the exposures it securitises; and
(v) that the Originator Requirement is satisfied on the Issue Date,

provided, however, that the Retention Holder may transfer the Retention Notes to the extent such transfer would not cause the transaction described in this Prospectus to cease to be compliant with the Retention Requirements.
Prospective investors should consider the discussion in "Risk Factors – Regulatory Initiatives – Risk Retention and Due Diligence" above.
Originator Requirement
By way of background, the CRR definition of an "originator" refers to an entity which:
(a) itself or through related entities, directly or indirectly, was involved in the original agreement which created the obligations being securitised; or
(b) purchases third party exposures "for its own account" and then securitises them.

Article 3(1)(4) of the regulatory technical standards adopted by the EU Commission on 12 March 2014 provides that, where the securitised exposures are created by multiple originators (as is the case in a managed CLO, where assets are acquired from numerous sellers in the market), the CRR Retention Requirements may be fulfilled in full by a single originator in circumstances where the relevant originator has established and is managing the scheme.
Originator Requirement means the requirement which will be satisfied if, on the Issue Date:
(a) the Aggregate Principal Balance of all Collateral Debt Obligations that have been acquired by the Issuer from the Collateral Manager; divided by
(b) the Target Par Amount,
is greater than or equal to 5 per cent. Origination of Collateral Debt Obligations General
The Collateral Manager may acquire assets which are intended to form part of the Collateral Debt
Obligations ("Originator Assets"), such Originator Assets being acquired in the primary market or in the secondary market from third parties ("Market Sellers").
In relation to any asset acquired by it, the Collateral Manager may from time to time:
(a) hold such asset to maturity;
(b) sell such asset to the market; or

(c) as is currently intended in all cases, sell the asset to a CLO in respect of which it is the collateral manager, including the Issuer, subject to the satisfaction of certain conditions described below.

The Collateral Manager, having due regard to assets and liabilities held on its own balance sheet from time to time, shall have absolute discretion to acquire, hold and/or sell assets at any time and, if appropriate, shall also have absolute discretion to nominate the CLO to which any asset is proposed to be sold to.
Application of Losses/Risk

Any credit risk arising in connection with the Collateral Manager’s ownership of any Originator Asset or losses in connection with its indirect financing of any Collateral Debt Obligation by way of its holding of the Retention Notes, shall be borne by the Collateral Manager.
Sale of Collateral Debt Obligations to CLOs

With a view to effectively managing its exposure to market price volatilities of the Originator Assets, the Collateral Manager may from time to time (and is expected to do so in the majority of cases) acquire Originator Assets and immediately enter into a forward purchase arrangement (a "Forward Purchase Arrangement") with one of the issuers established in connection with one of the CLOs managed by it (each, a "CLO Issuer"), under which the relevant CLO Issuer shall commit to purchase the relevant Originator Assets for the same purchase price as the Collateral Manager has committed to purchase that Collateral Debt Obligation from the relevant Market Seller (which shall be no earlier than 15 Business Days after the date of such commitment to purchase).

The CLO Issuer, the Collateral Manager and the Market Seller may also enter into a multilateral netting agreement (the "Netting Agreement") with respect to the purchase of an Originator Asset, which shall provide for the relevant Market Seller to enter into the assignment or transfer agreement required to effect the transfer of such Originator Asset directly with the CLO Issuer. Pursuant to the Netting Agreement, the Issuer shall, on the date of settlement, pay the purchase price of the Collateral Debt Obligation to the Collateral Manager, which the Collateral Manager shall correspondingly pay to the Market Seller.

In the event that any Originator Asset does not satisfy certain conditions precedent on the relevant purchase effective date to the relevant CLO Issuer, including if such obligation becomes defaulted, credit impaired or otherwise does not satisfy the eligibility criteria pursuant to the Warehouse Arrangements (if such purchase effective date falls prior to the Issue Date) or does not satisfy the Eligibility Criteria (if such purchase effective date falls on or after the Issue Date), the CLO Issuer will not be obliged to complete the purchase of the relevant asset and the applicable Forward Purchase Arrangement will be terminated. As a result, the Collateral Manager will be exposed to default and credit risk on such Originator Assets for the period between its purchase and the onward sale under the applicable Forward Purchase Arrangement.
